p: The prevalence of different HIV-1 subtypes have experienced a tremendous change in the FSU region and the present epidemic here is predominantly driven by heterosexual practice [ 8]. In recent decade, the epidemic evolved with an increase both in the incidence and prevalence of HIV-1 non-A6 subtypes, primarily recombinant forms [ 38]. Hence, recombinant forms spread are becoming a serious public health challenge, which requires a deeper understanding of their origin and distribution. Among the recombinant forms in FSU, HIV-1 CRF03_AB recombinant is one of the common recombinants and even the second most prevalent HIV-1 subtype [ 26] in some countries (Lithuania). We report here the results of the first systematic review of the CRF03_AB infection prevalence based on 32 eligible studies and also present its spatiotemporal dynamics in the FSU using publicly available sequences and Bayesian phylogenetic approach.
